intro: Chrysopsis linearifolia subsp. dressii, commonly known as the slenderleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and dry slopes. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy, composite flower heads. The subspecies dressii is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology and geographic distribution compared to the main species.
